intro: Phyllanthus mcvaughii, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and often unusual floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Phyllanthus mcvaughii is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
